intro: Geum strictum var. rugosum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed avens, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or toothed. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
